qas.question: Who is considered to own members of the Pygmies?
The treatment of Pygmies has been compared to the treatment of what?
When did the government of the Congo pass a law to assist indigenous people?
Who do many Bantus belong to?
When did the Congolese parliament strike down a law to protect indigenous people?
What is the last of its kind in Africa?
What does the Congolese Human Rights Observatory say Bantus are treated as?

plausible_answers.text: Pygmies belong from birth to Bantus

qas.question: What does no one refer to as slavery?

context: Many <b3_0><b7_0>Pygmies<b3_0/> belong from birth to <a0_0>Bantus<b7_0/><a0_0/> in a relationship many refer to as slavery. The Congolese Human Rights Observatory says that the Pygmies are treated as property the same way "<a1_0><b6_0>pets<b6_0/><a1_0/>" are. On <a2_0><b4_0>December 30, 2010<b4_0/><a2_0/>, the Congolese parliament adopted a law for the promotion and protection of the rights of indigenous peoples. <b5_0>This law<b5_0/> is the first of its kind in Africa, and its adoption is a historic development for indigenous peoples on the continent.
